result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernest R Lilly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ernest R Lilly is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ernest R Lilly was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernest R Lilly

records.addlTxt: Defendant's institutional incarceration terminated on 12-29-18; unpaid supervision fees of $134.75

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed by Court Reporter Karen Blair, January 22, 2016 sentencing hearing (Complete transcript filed in 15CF198)

10:04 A.M. Defendant Ernest R Lilly in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sentencing arguments, Court in recess at 10:28 A.M., Court back in session at 10:38 A.M., appearances the same, Court sentences defendant to: 14 CF 167, Ct. 6, 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, sentence to commence forthwith, $518.00 costs, 14 CF 394, Ct. 1, 2 years prison, 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision, concurrent, $518.00 costs, 1 day sentence credit, 14 CF 395, Ct. 1, 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, consecutive, $518.00 costs, $500.00 Restitution, 1 day sentence credit, 15 CF 198, Ct. 1, 6 months jail, concurrent, $1,379.00 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, 12 months D.L. revocation, 12 month Ignition Interlock Device, AODA and comply, Ct. 2, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, consecutive Ct. 3, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, consecutive, Ct. 4, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, consecutive, Bond to be applied towards Restitution and Costs, Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program, not eligible for challenge incarceration program, Court in recess at 10:49 A.M.
1/8/16 copy of PSI given to ADA Cross and Atty. Sarbacker

Court called at 11:05. Cases called: 15CF198, 14CM150, 14CM32, 14CF496, 14CF395, 14CF394, 14CF167, 15TR1590, 15TR1463R, 15TR1129, 14TR66, Defendant Ernest R Lilly in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 6 in 14CF167, count 1 in 14CF394 (ct. 2 dismissed), count 1 in 14CF395 (cts. 2-5 dismissed), counts 1-4 in 15CF198 (cts. 5-12 dismissed). Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, PSI ordered, to be completed in 60 days, sentencing be set 90 days out. 14CF496 & 14CM150 dismissed. All traffic citations dismissed. Court adjourned at 11:25.

Defendant Ernest R Lilly in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, stands mute, not guilty pleas entered, matter to be set for jury trial

Defendant Ernest R Lilly in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CM150, 14CF167, 14CF394, 14CF395, & 14CF496.  Matters are not resolved.  14CM150 not guilty plea entered.  Set for trial.  Bond remains.  In the felony cases:  Preliminary hearing requested by Atty Sarbacker.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Cross
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ernest R Lilly by video, in custody with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF394 & 14CF395.  $500.00 cash bond each case for a total of $1000.00.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Cases 14CM150 and 14CF167 should all track together.  New dates set for cases.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
